recipes.title: Hot Salsa
ingredients: 1 liberal tablespoon lime juice or 1 fresh lime
2 cans el pato yellow hot sauce
recipes.instructions: Chop jalapefios and onion. Press garlic into mixture. Add cumin, salt, and lime juice into chopped veg. Add el pato and mix then add rotel to the mixture. Best after standing overnight.

recipes.title: Mild Salsa
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon cumin (I like a rounded 1/2 tsp)
1 liberal tablespoon lime juice or 1 fresh lime
recipes.instructions: Chop onion. Add garlic, cumin, cilantro, salt, and lime juice. Then add el pato and mix together well. Finally add rotel to the mixture. Best after standing overnight.

recipes.title: Tomatillo Salsa
recipes.instructions:
I like to grill the vegetables, but you can also boil them in water until they are soft. For grilling, half the tomatillos, quarter the onion, green onion whole minus the sprouts, jalapenos and serranoes whole (just cut off the stems). Once you get a little char take on them off.

In a food processor or blender toss all grilled vegetables, garlic, 2 cubes chicken bouillon, cilantro (cut just a little of the stems off but keep the majority), squeeze 1 lime, and add salt and pepper. The remaining lime is to taste depending how you like it. If its too thick just add a little warm water to it while mixing. After that vou are all done

recipes.title: Crock Pot Chili - 2021
ingredients: Wick fowler base (didn’t use masa or red pepper packets).
115 Oz can members mark tomato sauce
Half tomato sauce can of water
1 Pound ground spicy Great Value Italian sausage cooked with a chopped medium onion (cook onion a bit before adding the Italian sausage)
1150z can hunts diced tomatoes (w celery, peppers, and onions)
1 can Great Value unsalted black beans
A 6 Oz approx glass of water (whole glass was a little too much)
Teaspoon of santitas white tortilla crumbs (I had some crumbs in the bottom is a bag | threw in.)
recipes.instructions:
Add tomato sauce and half can of water. Stir in seasoning packets, cumin, chili powder, oregano, garlic powder and salt.

Add tomatoes, black and ranch beans

Add cooked meat and jalepenos

Add water to correct consistency. Toss in tortilla crumbs

Cook in crock pot on high till heated thoroughly. Best after sitting overnight. Put back in crock pot and set on low.

recipes.title: Cowboy Beans
recipes.instructions:
Precook beans in water for 5 min

Mix all ingredients and cook 11/2 hours. (Original recipe said 45 min and natural release but that didn’t do it)

recipes.title: Instant Pot Chicken Broccoli and Rice
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into cubes
2 cups fresh broccoli, cut into small pieces
recipes.instructions:
1. Turn on the Instant Pot to sauté mode. Add oil, then cook chicken and onion until onion softens (3-4 minutes).

2. Add 1/2 cup broth and scrape the bottom to lift brown bits.

3. Spread chicken evenly, then add rice, remaining broth, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Do not stir.

4. Cook on manual high pressure for 5 minutes. Let natural release for 5 minutes, then quick release remaining pressure.

5. Open lid, quickly stir in broccoli and warmed milk. Close lid and let rest for 5-10 minutes.

6. Stir in cheddar cheese until melted. Add more milk if needed.

7. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Snack crackers
ingredients: 1 tbs Hidden valley ranch dry seasoning
1/2 tsp oklahoma joes French fry seasoning

recipes.title: Egg noodles recipe
ingredients: 1 Package of extra wide egg noodles
recipes.instructions:
Boil chicken thighs and set aside
Cook noodles in the chicken thigh water
Debone and dice the chicken
Drain noodles and add butter
Add soup and mix
Add chicken
Add milk to desired consistency

recipes.title: Easy egg nog pie
ingredients: 2 3.4 oz packages of vanilla instant pudding (cheesecake flavor works well also)
1 1/4 cup eggnog (Do not use fat free, you want a thick eggnog)
1 cup Whipped Topping (Cool Whip is perfect)
1 standard size graham cracker pie crust
recipes.instructions:
Beat pudding mix with eggnog, milk and nutmeg for two minutes.
Fold 1 cup COOL WHIP Whipped Topping into mixture until just combined.
Spoon mixture into pie crust.
Refrigerate at least three hours, up to 24.

Notes
The longer you chill this pie, the thicker it will get. Make sure you are not using skim or fat free milk or eggnog, the pie will not set up as thick as it does with a rich, thick full fat eggnog or whole milk. Also, make sure you measure precisely. This is based on a tried and true, used for decades pudding mix pie recipe, so if you use the right ingredients, and measure correctly, you will have great results.

recipes.title: Bills Greek Salad
ingredients: 2 6 Oz canripe olives (have to chop them)
1/2 cup red onion (chopped, soak in water 10 min and drain) (1/2 onion)
recipes.instructions: Mix well coating to taste with olive oil vinaigrette (separate recipe)

recipes.title: Peanut butter oatmeal balls
ingredients: 1/4 cup honey ( reduced from 1/2, was too much, too sticky)
recipes.instructions: Mix peanut butter and honey, heat 30 sec then stir in oats. Shape into 1.3 oz balls and refrigerate for an hour to set
